podcastContent: 敦煌壁画常常画这张画，就是维摩诘和文殊的对话。但我自己喜欢这一部经，常常抄这一部经，所以我觉得里面的对话好精彩。因为文殊菩萨进来了，到了病房就问说，诶，你是一个修行的人，那修行的人怎么会生病呢？你不是应该修行的这个程度已经很高了，你应该到了不生病的状况。那维摩诘就回答说：从师有爱，则我病生八个字，我常常写这8个字送朋友，我们知道痴情的痴这个字，就是理应知道不应该做的事，可是我情不自禁，我还是会做，从痴有爱，那我们也觉得很有趣，菩萨到底应不应该有爱，如果有爱是不是也有恨。就我觉得他触碰到大乘佛学非常惊人的部分，就从痴有爱则我病生，所以我生病，那文殊菩萨就问他，那你什么时候病会好。他说一切众生病好，我的病也就好。这个时候我们忽然发现维摩诘讲的病，不是一般的病，是说他承担了所有众生之病，我们知道这是大乘佛学。我们有一天知道一个人的修行到一定的程度，那个不关心是因为他有更高的关心。他会看到所有在现实里的争吵之上，应该有一个更为亲明的东西。所以我们常读到无无明，对无明的一种堪悟，能够有更大的了悟的可能。这是为摩皆经一直要传达的。

analysis.contentEssence: 以“病房对话”为入口，把个人之病提升为对众生苦病的共担与觉悟：爱与痴并非污点，而是通向大悲与更大了悟的门。
analysis.physicalMetaphor: 一盏油灯的灯芯被点燃后，火焰不向外爆发而是向内回卷，灯芯越烧越黑却让光圈逐层扩散，直到把整间病房都照亮。
analysis.metaphorVisualization: 中心是“被烧灼的灯芯”这一细长主形体（病/承担），其上方或周围出现几圈由强到弱的光晕（觉悟/大悲的扩散）；黑与光不对抗，而是同体共存：暗在芯里，明在晕里，形成向外回响的同心层。

tension.from: “修行人为何生病”的表面矛盾
tension.to: “众生病好我病乃好”的大悲承担与觉悟

topologicalLayout.zoneCountReason: 意象是“一盏灯在同一空间内由芯到光晕扩散”，病与悟同处一体，不需要拆分成多个对立区域。
topologicalLayout.divisionMethodReason: 光从灯芯向外形成圈层回响，最贴合“从痴有爱则我病生”到“众生病好我病乃好”的扩展性。

primaryRelationship.typeReason: 灯芯被光晕包裹：内层是“病/承担的灼点”，外层是“悲智的照明”，呈现由内而外的同体关系。

rhythmSignature.typeReason: 对话的要点像一句偈语不断扩散：从“八字”起，层层推出“众生之病”与“无无明”的回响。

structureParams.tensionExpression: 把“病”压缩成中心一处较暗、被烧灼的细芯；张力来自中心的沉重与外圈光晕的扩大之间的拉扯，外圈越扩，中心越显克制与承担。

antiTemplateCheck.howIsThisDifferent: 结构以“中心灼点+同心光晕扩散”的单域放射来表达‘以病示道、以己担众’，用嵌套与回响呈现悖论的同体性，而非把观点切成两边做对照。

prompt:
[CANVAS]
- Format: 1:1 square, 1024x1024 pixels
- Safe margin: 10% padding on all sides
- Whitespace target: 65% (large calm field, high Ma)
- Visual weight distribution: a very small, darkened center (wick) holding tension; three faint radial echoes expanding outward, most of the canvas kept quiet.

[TOPOLOGY] — based on topologicalLayout
- Zone count: 1 (single continuous space, no split panels)
- Division method: radial (concentric spatial logic, but keep it imperfect and organic)
- Zone ratios: 100
- Physical metaphor visualization: the entire field is one “sickroom-like” emptiness; illumination is expressed as radial halo layers emerging from a single wick point, staying within the same unified space.

[RELATIONSHIPS] — based on primaryRelationship
- Primary relationship type: nested
- Interaction quality: fused (halos feel optically fused into the background, not hard separate rings)
- Spatial expression: place a tiny wick at exact center or slightly above-center (within 3% shift). Wrap it with three nested halo bands that share soft boundaries and overlap subtly.

[RHYTHM] — based on rhythmSignature
- Rhythm type: echoing
- Element count: 3
- Interval/size variation: three halos repeat with gentle change—each ring slightly larger and slightly less opaque than the previous; spacing increases subtly outward (echo fade), but keep the overall rhythm calm and static.

[GEOMETRY]
- Primary shape: a tiny vertical wick mark (slim rounded-rectangle), height ~6–8% of canvas, width ~0.8–1.2%, centered. The top 20–30% is visibly charred: near-black/dark gray tip with a small irregular notch suggesting inward-curling flame (do NOT draw a flame silhouette).
- Secondary shapes (3): three imperfect circular/oval halo bands centered on the wick; each band is a thin, soft-edged ring-like area (not a hard outline), fused into the background.
- Lines: at most 1 ultra-thin vertical line integrated with the wick (optional); no dividers, no diagonals.
- Edge treatment: gradient-fade edges everywhere; soft transitions, no sharp ring outlines.
- Negative space: keep the outer 40–50% of the canvas nearly empty, only the faintest residual illumination.

[COLOR]
- Background: cool-mist (#F5F7FA)
- Primary hue (halos): soft-gold (#FFF3CD), very high lightness (~95%), used as translucent halo layers
- Secondary hue accent: celadon (#DCEDC8) used at 2% area only, opacity 12% (a tiny offset speck or micro-smear near the second halo, not forming any symbol)
- Temperature: warm-cool contrast (warm halos against cool background) to evoke lucid insight
- Contrast method: brightness contrast—darkened wick tip vs luminous pale halos
- Accent usage: extremely subtle, barely noticeable celadon cue; must not create a second focal point.

[LIGHTING]
- Light source: implied from the wick core
- Glow effects: 2 total glows only—one tight inner glow around the wick (soft-gold), one broader outer glow fading into background (soft-gold).
- Ambient atmosphere: clean, quiet, clinically airy but compassionate.

[TEXTURE & MATERIAL] — Prajñā micro-adjustments only
- Surface quality: smooth, paper-like digital matte
- Edge sharpness: soft (no crisp outlines), gentle diffusion
- Transparency: halos are semi-transparent; outermost halo nearly dissolves.

[ATMOSPHERE & MOOD]
- Japanese aesthetic: Ma (dominant empty field), Kanso (few elements), Shibui (subtle restraint)
- Content resonance: the wick grows darker (burden/illness) while light expands (compassion/insight), suggesting “illumination that doesn’t escape the room, but clarifies it.”

[STYLE]
- Render style: clean vector-like digital art
- No photorealism, no 3D rendering
- No text, no symbols, no UI
- Must read clearly at 128px thumbnail: a tiny charred wick center + three faint echo halos in a cool-mist field.
